evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Discussed procrastination on literature review, work-break neglect causing back pain, negative self-talk about academic performances, and career networking avoidance. Solutions included 15-minute work starters, stretch-break reminders with spot-saving keywords, reframing failures humorously, sending professor emails, and celebratory breaks. Lisa responded with sarcastic compliance but implemented all solutions: set timers, sent email, took breaks, acknowledged successes, and set STEM curriculum goal. Progress evidenced by initiated task, sent career email, taken self-care actions, and defined winter objective.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems: Overwhelm with coursework (lit review procrastination), physical strain from long study sessions, negative thought loops at bedtime, and career anxiety. Solutions: 15-minute task starts, stretch breaks with keyword tracking, pre-sleep positivity ritual, and achievement rewards. Lisa responded with initial sarcasm but implemented: timer for work, stretch reminders, reframed thesis disaster humorously, sent networking email, and celebrated with latte/dance. Progress: Demonstrated through concrete behavior changes, self-deprecating humor transformed into actionable strategies, and ownership of career goals.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Discussed procrastination on literature review, sleep deprivation, career anxiety, and fear of academic failure. Solutions offered included micro-tasking (15-minute work sessions), pre-sleep reframing rituals, stretch breaks, and immediate career outreach. Lisa responded with initial resistance but demonstrated progress by starting her literature review, sending a professor email, reframing past failures with humor, and accepting self-care routines. Evidence includes her sending the email despite fears, implementing stretch breaks, and creating a sleep ritual.

Solutions included micro-work sessions (15-minute timer), stretch breaks with keyword notes, pre-sleep ritual replacement technique, humor reframing of past failures, and immediate career outreach action. Progress evidenced by completed outreach action, adoption of break system, willingness to try sleep ritual, and engagement in celebration behavior.
